pageContext._xxxcollectionOwnerNamextxt: Arts Library, Special Collections, University of California at Los Angeles (UCLA)
pageContext._xxxcollectionDescriptionxtxt: Consists of scripts, clippings, pressbooks, scrapbooks, programs, photographs, awards, records, correspondence and miscellaneous material related to Russell's career. Also includes papers related to Russell's husband, Frederick Brisson, who served as chief of radio propaganda and special consultant to the Secretary of War during World War II. Includes radio sketches on which Russell appeared for the Special Services Division, A.S.F. and also material related to the Office of Radio Production.
